item.title: Apostate Christendom
item.description: “Two ministers were talking one to another one time and one was trying to be charitable and said, ‘You know, we both serve God. You in your way and I in His.’” — Douglas Wilson What i’ve learned over the last few years is this - name calling doesn’t win anyone. I got banned recently for calling a group “elitists” for holding views I didnt hold. Don’t get me wrong, I was right, but there was no profit in name calling.

item.title: Article Review - Bad Faith
item.description: https://granta.com/bad-faith/ Bad Faith - Ken Follett (ex-CoG movement turned athiest) Every sect needs jargon. We did not have churches, we had halls; services were called meetings; the congregation was the assembly; the elders were overseers. The Fellowship paid much more attention to the petty rules of Paul than to the open-hearted wisdom of Jesus. At the age of fifteen, Dad went to a meeting of the Open Brethren.
